intro: Sethia obtusifolia var. stylosa, commonly known as the Stylosa Sethia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant features finely divided, feathery leaves that are often aromatic. Its flowers are typically small and white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along streambanks.
